glsa.title: Apache 1.3: Buffer overflow vulnerability in mod_include
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability exists in mod_include which could possibly allow a local attacker to gain escalated privileges.

background.p: The Apache HTTP server is one of the most popular web servers on the internet. mod_include is an Apache module to handle Server Side Includes (SSI).

description.p: A possible buffer overflow exists in the get_tag() function of mod_include.c.

impact.p: If Server Side Includes (SSI) are enabled, a local attacker may be able to run arbitrary code with the rights of an httpd child process by making use of a specially-crafted document with malformed SSI.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Apache users should upgrade to the latest version:
